title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Wednesday, 28 October 2015 - BBC News
summary: an outbreak of norovirus forces the closure of two wards at addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge .
a driver has is left shaken and bruised after his vehicle was repeatedly rammed in fulbourn .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: that 's it from cambridgeshire live for wednesday
text: goodnight from the cambridgeshire live team .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget , you can send us your stories , and comments at any time .
send them to us via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pudsey avoids the rain in huntingdon
text: luckily it stopped raining before pudsey got soaked in huntingdon today .
pudsey appeared on huntingdon market on bbc radio cambridgeshire 's children in need tour of the county .
tomorrow we will be in ely .
author: Emma Borley
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: lucy frazer among more than 100 mps urging david cameron to deliver on school funding reform
text: south east cambridgeshire mp lucy frazer has added her voice to a cross-party call to the prime minister to deliver on school funding reform .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: weather : a dry night with clear spells
text: tonight will be mostly dry with clear spells and occasional cloud .
temperatures falling to 8c ( 46f ) .
a dry and perhaps bright start tomorrow , but thickening cloud will bring patchy outbreaks of rain from the west .
feeling mild with temperatures reaching up to 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East Weather

documents.title: a10 to remain closed into 'evening peak ' following crash
text: cambridgeshire county council is advising that the a10 between stretham and waterbeach will remain closed `` into evening peak '' .
diversions are in place .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a10 crash update : 'serious collision ' between motorcycle and a van
text: police say emergency services are services are currently at the scene of a serious collision between a motorbike and a van on the a10 .
a road closure has been put in place between the a1123/a10 roundabout at stretham and the cambridge research park just north of waterbeach .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : section of a10 closed following crash addenbrooke 's wards remain shut after norovirus outbreak
text: if you 're just joining us here are the headlines so far this afternoon :
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: a10 crash update : road closed in both directions between waterbeach and stretham
text: police say the a10 is closed in both directions between stretham and the cambridge research park near waterbeach , following a crash .
# a10 closed between # stretham a1123/a10 roundabout and cambridge research park ( just north of waterbeach ) due to an incident .
@ twitterid can you say what happened ?
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : a10 at stretham closed in both directions following a crash
text: the a10 between cambridge and ely is closed in both directions following a crash .
drivers are advised to use an alternative route .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: gymnastics : smith aiming for team glory in glasgow
text: cambridgeshire 's louis smith will be hoping to secure a top-three finish with great britain 's men in this evening 's team final at the world gymnastics championships in glasgow .
smith , who top scored on the pommel horse during qualifying , has never previously won a team medal at a world championships .
by reaching the final , team gb 's men have already secured qualification for the team event at next summer 's rio olym
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: your cambridge rooftops
text: the .
we 're featuring at the top of the page today is a silhouette of cambridge rooftops taken by photoblogger sir cam .
you can send us your

documents.title: peterborough police turn to skype for appointments with public
text: police in peterborough are trialling a new appointments system to allow officers to spend more time patrolling .
members of the public will be asked to go to thorpe wood police station or speak to an officer via the telephone or skype .
supt melanie dales said : `` it will allow officers who use a large proportion of their time travelling across the city to and from appointments more time to patrol their neighbourhoods '' .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cyclists react to cambridge police bad bike parking tweets
text: photos of `` flying '' bikes haphazardly left on the top of fences or suspended from trees tweeted by cambridge police have prompted a response from cyclists .
several respondents said a lack of bike racks in the city was contributing to the problem .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: addenbrooke 's wards likely to remain closed following norovirus outbreak
text: two wards which were closed following an outbreak of norovirus at addenbrooke 's in cambridge are likely to remain shut beyond today , the hospital says .
the two wards affected are g3 and c4 which are used for caring for elderly patients .
staff at the hospital are asking anyone who has been ill with vomiting or diarrhoea in the last few days to stay away .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: march house getting into the spooky spirit
text: halloween preparations are complete at the home of tommy and jo kelly in the fenland town of march .
spooky !
is this the most decorated house for halloween in cambridgeshire ?
if you 've seen anything which could steal the crown , we 'd love to see your which you can send via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two hundred new jobs as amazon builds sunday service
text: online retailing giant amazon is strengthening its sunday delivery service with the opening of a new depot in peterborough , which could help create more than 200 jobs .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: snooker : cambridgeshire pair set up potential semi-final clash
text: cambridgeshire 's joe perry and neil robertson could meet in the semi-finals of snooker 's international championship should they both win their quarter-final ties .
perry has set up a last-four clash with john higgins after beating ben woolsaton 6-5 , while neil robertson will take on either mark selby or michael white .
he beat graeme dott 6-1 .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: cambridgeshire officers collect police bravery award for tackling armed man
text: pcs janine hagger and pete moulton collected the eastern region bravery award at the police federation 's annual bravery awards ceremony in london last night .
the cambridgeshire officers won the award for restraining a man wielding a knife , shears , saw and garden fork .
pc janine hagger , pc pete moulton @ twitterid reg4 # policebravery award winners for fending off man on violent rampage
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid # policebravery awards last night .
fenland officers win award .
@ twitterid @ twitterid brilliant recognition for people who put others first .
@ twitterid @ twitterid congratulations !
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : winter vomiting bug closes addenbrooke 's wards giant poppy painted on st ives pitch
text: here are the headlines for cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: giant poppy on st ives pitch should be visible for two months
text: a giant 23m ( 75ft ) poppy , painted on the pitch at one leisure in st ives , should be visible for two months says groundsman rob bradshaw .
rob says he `` got a kick '' out of creating the design to mark the annual poppy appeal , which took around eight hours to complete .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridgeshire one of best places in uk for early cancer diagnosis
text: cambridgeshire cancer patients are in one of the best areas of the uk for early diagnosis according to cancer research uk .
the charity found `` unacceptable variation '' between different areas after reviewing cases in 2012 and 2013 .
the worst area for late diagnosis was merseyside , where half of cancers were found at a late stage , compared to 44 % in east anglia ( including cambridgeshire ) .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: addenbrooke 's hospital norovirus outbreak 'has to be taken seriously '
text: an outbreak of norovirus at addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge `` has to be taken seriously '' according to a virologist based at the hospital .
two wards have been closed and staff are asking people with symptoms to stay away .
dr chris smith said : `` if you get a big outbreak in a healthcare setting you could be in trouble if you do n't take action quickly . ''
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: fireworks displays in cambridgeshire - our guide to bonfire night 2015 events
text: it 's time to light the sparklers here 's our guide to the fireworks displays in your area .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: trading standards warning issued following kimbolton fireworks theft
text: trading standards officers are urging people to only buy fireworks from legitimate traders following the theft of pyrotechnics worth £ 100,000 , from kimbolton fireworks .
director stuart adlam says staff are `` working hours of overtime '' to fulfil bonfire night orders .
he added they were `` devastated to hear about the theft , after all their hard work over last 12 months getting ready for this november season '' .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: weather : a drier afternoon is in store with perhaps brighter spells
text: after a cloudy and wet morning , this afternoon is looking much drier with perhaps some brightness developing by the end of the day .
top temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: heavy rain causes flooding on some roads in the county
text: heavy rain across cambridgeshire earlier has caused flooding on some roads - this is mill lane in hinxton .
send us your flood .
via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Sara Varey
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: police in cambridge take to twitter to highlight bad bike parking
text: officers in cambridge are tweeting examples they 've encountered of badly parked cycles in the city .
this high-rise one was taken near the station , which is undergoing re-development work .
have you seen an examples around cambridge ?
we 'd love to see your send them by email or twitter .
flying bike or # badlyparkedbike ?
can you find any contenders for this prestigious hashtag in cambridge city ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid gosh .
this shows me that 6 badly parked bikes take up less space than 1 car !
@ twitterid @ twitterid true , but bikes have more 'sticky - out bits ' that can snag passers - by
@ twitterid @ twitterid so microsco more likely to bruise pedestrians when stationary .
when moving however car more dangerous !
re @ twitterid # badlyparkedbike sounds like the name of a local indie band @ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid i 'm sure i saw # badlyparkedbike play the boat race circa 1992
@ twitterid what problem is that anyway ?
near none issue or # wasteofpolicetime ?
can you find any other contenders for a more pointless police twitter campaign by @ twitterid ?
@ cambridgecops are any of those bikes forcing pedestrians onto the road , surely cars parked on the pavement are more antisocial ?
@ twitterid lack of secure parking spots inspires creativity
@ twitterid brilliant use of space , where there is clearly a dearth of proper cycle parking .
@ twitterid surely the real story here is the scandalous shortage of proper bike parking , rather than blaming people for improvising ?
@ twitterid walked past that today , thought it showed great initiative as there is n't enough parking for bikes at the station
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: driver left shaken and bruised after vehicle rammed in fulbourn
text: a driver has been left shaken and bruised and his vehicle extensively damaged after it was rammed in balsham road , fulbourn , police say .
five people in a dark blue honda hrv repeatedly rammed the vehicle and threw metal items at the windscreen about 20:30 on sunday .
`` this was a particularly nasty incident which has left the victim shaken and bruised , '' pc claire dunkley said .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: football groundsman creates 'giant poppy ' on day off
text: a giant 23m ( 75ft ) poppy , painted on the pitch at one leisure in st ives , was created by groundsman rob bradshaw on his day off .
the outdoor leisure and sports facility , which is run by huntingdonshire district council , will be holding a collection for the poppy appeal this weekend .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: explosive point : demonstrating why campaigners want a sugar tax
text: the naked scientists rigged up this experiment involving fire and cornflour to demonstrate how much energy sugar contains - and why some health campaigners are calling for a sugar tax .
a sugar tax and cutting buy-one-get-one-free deals are part of public health england 's `` key actions '' to tackle people 's addiction to sugar .
author: Sue Dougan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: peterborough soaked by heavy rain
text: half the rain in october in peterborough has fallen on a soggy city this morning .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: headlines : winter vomiting bug closes wards at addenbrooke 's hospital driver left shaken and bruised after car repeatedly rammed
text: here are the headlines for cambridgeshire so far this morning :
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: louis smith set for gymnastics final in glasgow later today
text: cambridgeshire 's louis smith is part of the gb men 's team competing in the world gymnastics championships team final in glasgow later today .
smith , who trains in huntingdon , posted a commanding 15.533 on the pommel horse in his first world championships appearance since 2011 on sunday .
the team also includes max whitlock , dan purvis , nile wilson , kristian thomas and brinn bevan .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: on the road with pudsey : week long childen in need tour of cambridgeshire arrives in huntingdon
text: pudsey arrives in huntngdon today on day three of bbc radio cambridgeshire 's children in need tour of the county .
he 'll be on huntingdon market today from 11:00 - hopefully it will stop raining .
full tour details , and photos from yesterday in peterborough , are on our facebook page .
author: Emma Borley
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: christmas-crazy cambridge pub pulls out all the festive stops
text: david utting , who owns the empress on thoday street , has decked the halls of the pub with lashings of tinsel , lights and decorations in anticipation of the festive season .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: heavy rain causes flooding on cambridgshire roads
text: heavy rain is starting to flood some roads in the county - this is on station road in dullingham .
we 're also hearing of problems in the area around whittlesford in south cambridgeshire .
send us your flood .
via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Chris Mann
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'how not to leave your bike ' : cambridge police showcase examples of bad bike parking
text: officers in cambridge have taken to twitter to highlight bad bike parking in the city .
another example from cambridge city of how not to leave your bike # badlyparkedbike
@ cambridgecops yet you still do n't address cars blocking the pavements .
you target cycles to appease the car addicts .
@ twitterid we 've been over this before we target any careless or inconsiderate road users .
@ cambridgecops so where are the of the pavement parked cars you 've dealt with ?
@ twitterid we deal with these on a regular basis too , but it 's not the purpose of this particular crime prevention/road safety message
@ cambridgecops and how are those bikes there illegal ?
they do n't seem to block the pavement or cause any harm .
@ cambridgecops but this is easy enough for you surely - start showing us the cars you deal with that were blocking the pavements .
@ twitterid we 've got plenty of examples : watch this space shortly
@ cambridgecops good .
and what 's illegal about the bikes you just sent oit a of ?
@ twitterid what 's wrong with that ?
it 's out of peoples way , not blocking anythingit 's just highlighting the lack of proper racks again !
@ twitterid would you agree if you owned that tree ?
@ twitterid the bike does n't appear to be even touching the tree
@ twitterid true - but this is exactly the sort of scenario that people complain about ; at least it is actually locked though .
@ twitterid but why are people complaining about itand why are you fanning those flames by tweeting it as a bad example ?
@ twitterid because it affects local residents , businesses and other road users .
we want people to rethink where and how they park their bike .
@ twitterid how does it affect hemother than some people might think it 's a bit untidy ?
seriously , what it the problem here ?
cambridge police tweet examples of `` how not to leave your bike '' in the city @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid a lot of officers are keen cyclists too ; but you would n't find them parking their bike up a tree irrespective
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid easy to find a place to lock your bike when you work at a police station .
not easy for commuters
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid we would suggest the council would be able to provide you with details of where the city 's racks are
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid no need i 'll be driving in my large 4x4 and parking on pavement now on # badlyparkedbike
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid we would strongly recommend you did n't .
@ twitterid in fact i 'll take a of my car on pavement and tweet it to you and you still wo n't go anything # badlyparkedbike
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridgeshire officers win police bravery award
text: two cambridgeshire officers have won a police bravery award for restraining a man wielding a knife , shears , saw and garden fork .
pc janine hagger and pc pete moulton were presented with the eastern region bravery award at the police federation 's annual bravery awards ceremony in london last night .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: consultation begins on plans for thousands of new waterbeach homes
text: developers behind plans for thousands have new homes on the former barracks at waterbeach , near cambridge , have begun finding out what people living in the area think about the proposals .
proposals for an 8,000 home new town on the site were part of south cambridgeshire district council 's local plan .
rebecca britton , from the developers urban & civic , says people have raised concerns over the scale of the project .

documents.title: huntingdon sports ground gets poppy makeover
text: the one leisure pitch in st ives has been decorated with a giant poppy thanks to groundsman rob bradshaw .

documents.title: cambridge debate is dominated by 'nimbys and self-appointed middle-class minorities '
text: cambridge 's political debate is `` dominated by nimbys '' and `` self-appointed middle-class minorities '' , it is claimed .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: football : peterborough 's elder eyeing league one title challenge
text: defender callum elder believes peterborough united have the potential to challenge for the league one title , but need to play with greater consistency .
he says : the next step for us is to become more consistent and up three points as often as we can .
we 're a few points from the top , but we believe that we 'll get up there eventually if we keep playing our best on a regular basis . ''
posh trail leaders gillingham by 10 points .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: winter vomiting bug closes wards at addenbrooke 's hospital
text: an outbreak of norovirus has forced the closure of two wards at addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge .
the wards affected are g3 and c4 .
staff at the hospital are asking anyone who has been ill with vomiting or diarrhoea in the last few days to stay away .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: peterborough woman arrested after cyclist seriously injured in road collision
text: a peterborough woman has been arrested on sus of dangerous driving after a collision left a cyclist in a serious condition in peterborough city hospital .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: weather : heavy rain this morning , but brighter later
text: outbreaks of heavy rain this morning , but with some bright or sunny spells developing before the end of the day .
top temperature 14c ( 57f ) : for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: hello and welcome to cambridgeshire live for wednesday - we 'll have live news , sport , travel and weather updates for the county until 18:00 .
you can send us your stories , and comments at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
news and weather updates for this morning coming up shortly .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
